title: error creating an s3 remote
body:
#### What is the problem?
I'm hitting some issues setting up an s3 remote. We got permission to upload an updated datalad version of HBN BIDS to the fcp-indi bucket at s3://fcp-indi/data/Projects/HBN/BIDS_datalad. 

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
```bash
$ export AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY="MyActualSecretKey"
$ export AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID="MyActualAccessKey"
$ cd HBN_BIDS
$ datalad siblings
.: here(+) [git]
.: origin(+) [/cbica/projects/RBC/RBC_EXEMPLARS/hbn_exemplars (git)]
$ git annex initremote public-s3 \
    type=S3 bucket=fcp-indi \
    public=yes datacenter=us-east-1 \
    fileprefix=data/Projects/HBN/BIDS_datalad \
    encryption=none
initremote public-s3 (checking bucket...) (creating bucket in us-east-1...)
git-annex: HttpExceptionRequest Request {
  host                 = "fcp-indi.s3-us-east-1.amazonaws.com"
  port                 = 80
  secure               = False
  requestHeaders       = [("Date","Mon, 16 Aug 2021 20:30:00 GMT"),("Authorization","<REDACTED>"),("x-amz-acl","public-read")]
  path                 = "/"
  queryString          = ""
  method               = "PUT"
  proxy                = Nothing
  rawBody              = False
  redirectCount        = 10
  responseTimeout      = ResponseTimeoutDefault
  requestVersion       = HTTP/1.1
}
 (ConnectionFailure Network.Socket.getAddrInfo (called with preferred socket type/protocol: AddrInfo {addrFlags = [AI_ADDRCONFIG], addrFamily = AF_UNSPEC, addrSocketType = Stream, addrProtocol = 6, addrAddress = <assumed to be undefined>, addrCanonName = <assumed to be undefined>}, host name: Just "fcp-indi.s3-us-east-1.amazonaws.com", service name: Just "80"): does not exist (Name or service not known))
failed
git-annex: initremote: 1 failed
```

Any ideas? The `service name: Just "80"` looks strange to me.

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

0.14.6
